During pregnancy, sleeping positions become particularly important for the comfort and safety of both the mother and the growing baby.

 • Experts generally recommend sleeping on your side during pregnancy, preferably the left side. This position improves circulation to the heart, uterus, and kidneys, allowing for optimal blood flow and nutrient delivery to the baby.

 • Placing pillows strategically can help support your body and alleviate discomfort while sleeping. You can try placing a pillow between your knees, under your abdomen, and behind your back to help maintain a comfortable side sleeping position.

 • Sleeping on your back, especially as pregnancy progresses, can cause pressure on major blood vessels, leading to decreased blood flow to the uterus and potentially causing dizziness, shortness of breath, and other discomforts.
